DataElement.preferredName: Patient Hot Flashes Stratification Factors Daily Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of daily hot flashes the patient has as a stratification factor for participation on a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A temporary feeling of intense body warmth, flushing, sometimes accompanied by sweating. A common, symptom of menopause; other conditions that can produce hot flushes include antidepressants and drugs blocking the effect of estrogens, carcinoid tumors and a sensitivity to sulfites or other food additives._Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A sudden, temporary onset of body warmth, flushing, and sweating (often associated with menopause).:Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

Concepts.definition: A temporary feeling of intense body warmth, flushing, sometimes accompanied by sweating. A common, symptom of menopause; other conditions that can produce hot flushes include antidepressants and drugs blocking the effect of estrogens, carcinoid tumors and a sensitivity to sulfites or other food additives.
Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/19/2021: CM Released as part of draft content review

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hot Flashes Stratification Factors Daily Count
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number of daily hot flashes.

PermissibleValues.value: 10 or more hot flashes per day
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than or Equal To Ten Hot Flashes Per Day

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Ten Hot Flashes Per Day
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.: A sudden, temporary onset of body warmth, flushing, and sweating (often associated with menopause).: A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.

A temporary feeling of intense body warmth, flushing, sometimes accompanied by sweating. A common, symptom of menopause; other conditions that can produce hot flushes include antidepressants and drugs blocking the effect of estrogens, carcinoid tumors and a sensitivity to sulfites or other food additives.
A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Four To Nine Hot Flashes Per Day

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Four To Nine Hot Flashes Per Day
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: A natural number greater than 8 and less than 10 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.: A sudden, temporary onset of body warmth, flushing, and sweating (often associated with menopause).: A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A natural number greater than 8 and less than 10 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.

A temporary feeling of intense body warmth, flushing, sometimes accompanied by sweating. A common, symptom of menopause; other conditions that can produce hot flushes include antidepressants and drugs blocking the effect of estrogens, carcinoid tumors and a sensitivity to sulfites or other food additives.
A frequency rate of occurrences of something within a period of time equal to twenty-four hours.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
